\begin{document}

\tableofcontents
\phantomsection\label{index::doc}


Contents:


\chapter{Configuration}
\label{contents/ConfigurationFile:configuration}\label{contents/ConfigurationFile::doc}\label{contents/ConfigurationFile:welcome-to-mulan-s-documentation}

\section{Three configuration files}
\label{contents/ConfigurationFile:three-configuration-files}
Three configuration files control the code.


\section{The file \texttt{setup.ini}}
\label{contents/ConfigurationFile:the-file-setup-ini}
This file includes several sections that are read by the code.


\subsection{The \texttt{Modelling} section}
\label{contents/ConfigurationFile:the-modelling-section}
As many line ...Models and ...DateRages as locations observatory (Earth, Spiter, K2...). Two line mandatory. If do not know, psbl\_par. tmin-tmax with tmin\textless{}tmax.


\subsection{The \texttt{Archive} section}
\label{contents/ConfigurationFile:the-archive-section}
The following options are currently supported.

\begin{Verbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{Archive}\PYG{p}{]}

\PYG{n}{Name} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{trial4}
\PYG{n}{Path} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{Archive}\PYG{o}{/}
\end{Verbatim}

Every time the code is run, a \code{zip} archive is created in the working directory. The field \code{Name} corresponds to the name given to the archive. It is allowed to choose a personal path by filling the field \code{path} \footnote[1]{\sphinxAtStartFootnote%
Do not forget the character \code{/} at the end of any path.
}.

In the example above, a file \code{trial4.zip} is created in the directory \code{path-to-working-directory/Archive/}.


\subsection{Summary}
\label{contents/ConfigurationFile:summary}
Here is an example of an actual configuration file \code{setup.ini}.

\begin{Verbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{EventDescription}\PYG{p}{]}

\PYG{n}{Name} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{OB150966}
\PYG{n}{RA} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{17}\PYG{n}{h55m01}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{l+m+mi}{02}\PYG{n}{s}
\PYG{n}{DEC} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{l+m+mi}{29}\PYG{n}{d02m49}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{l+m+mi}{6}\PYG{n}{s}


\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{Observatories}\PYG{p}{]}

\PYG{n}{Reference} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{OGLE}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{I}

\PYG{n}{OGLE}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{I} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{7100}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{l+m+mi}{7157}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{7159}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{l+m+mi}{7230}
\PYG{n}{Spitzer}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{I} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{7100}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{l+m+mi}{7230}


\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{Plotting}\PYG{p}{]}

\PYG{n}{Data} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{k+kc}{True}
\PYG{n}{Type} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{plottype1}
\PYG{n}{TimeRange} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{7100}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{l+m+mi}{7230}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{5000}


\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{Modelling}\PYG{p}{]}

\PYG{n}{Fit} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{k+kc}{False}
\PYG{n}{Verbose} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{2}
\PYG{n}{Method} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{grid\PYGZus{}dmcmc}

\PYG{n}{EarthModels} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{psbl\PYGZus{}par}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{esblparall}
\PYG{n}{EarthDateRanges} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{7100}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{l+m+mi}{7150}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{7200}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{l+m+mi}{7300}

\PYG{n}{SpitzerModels} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{psbl\PYGZus{}par}
\PYG{n}{SpitzerDateRanges} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{7100}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{l+m+mi}{7150}

\PYG{n}{t0}    \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{fit}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{7205.1937}
\PYG{n}{u0}    \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{fix}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{l+m+mf}{0.01152}
\PYG{n}{tE}    \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{fit}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{57.7}
\PYG{n}{rho}   \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{grid}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{0.01}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{0.1}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{20}
\PYG{n}{gamma} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{fix}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{0.0}
\PYG{n}{piEE}  \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{fix}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{l+m+mf}{0.237}
\PYG{n}{piEN}  \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{fit}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{l+m+mf}{0.0412}
\PYG{n}{s}     \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{fix}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{1.1147}
\PYG{n}{q}     \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{fix}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{0.000168}
\PYG{n}{alpha} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{fit}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{l+m+mf}{2.2619426535897933}
\PYG{n}{dalpha} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{fix}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{0.0}
\PYG{n}{ds} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{fix}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mf}{0.0}

\PYG{n}{tp} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mf}{7208.88}

\PYG{n}{thetaEN} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mf}{0.5}
\PYG{n}{thetaEE} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mf}{0.2}


\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{FitSetupDMCMC}\PYG{p}{]}

\PYG{n}{Threads} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{7}
\PYG{n}{Chains} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{16}
\PYG{n}{ChainLength} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{100000}
\PYG{n}{Resume} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{k+kc}{False}
\PYG{n}{Path} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{chains}\PYG{o}{/}


\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{Archive}\PYG{p}{]}

\PYG{n}{Name} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{AZERTY}
\PYG{n}{Path} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{Archives}\PYG{o}{/}
\end{Verbatim}


\section{The file \texttt{observatories.ini}}
\label{contents/ConfigurationFile:the-file-observatories-ini}

\subsection{The \texttt{PlotExcludedData} section}
\label{contents/ConfigurationFile:the-plotexcludeddata-section}
The only option in this section is

\begin{Verbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{PlotExcludedData} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{k+kc}{True}
\end{Verbatim}

that makes the excluded data semi-transparents (\code{True}) or remove them from the plots (\code{False}).


\subsection{The \texttt{ObservatoriesDetails} section}
\label{contents/ConfigurationFile:the-observatoriesdetails-section}
This section includes all the observational information about the data files. As many options as data files are defined. The values of each option include the name of the observatory, the color associated to it, its location, and an additional list of data points that have to be removed from the data file.

Be carefull, the data file should be dates, magnitude, e\_magn, seeing, bkground.

\textbf{Example}

\begin{Verbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{OGLE}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{I} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{OGLE}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{000000}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{I}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{Earth}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{341}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{l+m+mi}{372}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{233}
\PYG{n}{Spitzer}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{I} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{Spitzer} \PYG{l+m+mf}{0.85}\PYG{n}{m}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{FF0000}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{I}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{Spitzer}
\end{Verbatim}

In this example, the code will look for the files \code{OGLE-I.dat} and \code{Spitzer-I.dat} \footnote[2]{\sphinxAtStartFootnote%
The extention can be what ever you like.
}. It is highly recommended that the name of the file includes the filter. The corresponding observatories are \code{OGLE} and \code{Spitzer 0.85m}. The colours used will be \code{\#000000} and \code{\#FF0000}. The filters are both \code{I}. The first observatory is on Earth whereas the second one is space-based. It is mandatory that the two files named \code{Hori-Earth\_whatever-you-want.dat} and \code{Hori-Spitzer\_whatever-you-want.dat} including ephemerids exist. Finally, in the case of OGLE data, the observations lines 341 to 372 and 233 will be removed. You can include as many data to remove as it is necessary, or nothing.


\subsection{Summary}
\label{contents/ConfigurationFile:id3}
Here is an example of an actual configuration file \code{setup.ini}.

\begin{Verbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{PlotOptions}\PYG{p}{]}

\PYG{n}{PlotExcludedData} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{k+kc}{False}


\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{n}{ObservatoriesDetails}\PYG{p}{]}

\PYG{n}{OGLE}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{I} \PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n}{OGLE}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{000000}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{I}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{Earth}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{341}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{l+m+mi}{372}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{233}
